quote: An artist is somebody who produces things that people don't need to have.
author: Andy Warhol

quote: An artist is somebody who produces things that people don't need to have.
author: Andy Warhol,  Andy Warhol, Thirty Are Better Than One

quote: Artists themselves are not confined, but their output is.
author: Robert Smithson

quote: The best artists know what to leave out.
author: Charles de Lint

quote: I don't think there's any artist of any value who doesn't doubt what they're doing.
author: Francis Ford Coppola

quote: Art doesn't interest me. Only artists interest me.
author: Marcel Duchamp

quote: Great artists suffer for the people.
author: Marvin Gaye

quote: An artist is someone who can hold two opposing viewpoints and still remain fully functional.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: What an artist is trying to do for people is bring them closer to something, because of course art is about sharing. You wouldn't be an artist unless you wanted to share an experience, a thought.
author: David Hockney

quote: Every artist was first an amateur.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Lesser artists borrow, great artists steal.
author: Igor Stravinsky

quote: Artists don't make objects. Artists make mythologies.
author: Anish Kapoor

quote: I am an artist... I am here to live out loud.
author: Emile Zola

quote: If you live through the initial stage of fame and get past it, and remember thats not who you are. If you live past that, then you have a hope of maybe learning how to spell the word artist.
author: Patrick Swayze

quote: I don't believe in art. I believe in artists.
author: Marcel Duchamp

quote: Art depends on luck and talent.
author: Francis Ford Coppola

quote: It’s a shame how much artists have to bleed for people to enjoy their work.
author: Solange nicole

quote: The artist belongs to his work, not the work to the artist.
author: Novalis

quote: Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: I think an artist's responsibility is more complex than people realize.
author: Jodie Foster

quote: All I tell artists is, 'Do what you love. Never let anybody talk you into changing what your musical idea is just to try to get a hit, because you're chasing your tail that way. It's not going to happen, and if you're successful, you have to do it the rest of your life. Stay true to it and do it for the sake of the art.'
author: Gloria Estefan

quote: . . . All artists’ work is autobiographical. Any writer’s work is a map of their psyche. You can really see what their concerns are, what their obsessions are, and what interests them.
author: Kim Addonizio

quote: The artist lives to have stories to tell and to learn to tell them well.
author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy

quote: There is nothing new in art except talent.
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: Immature artists imitate. Mature artists steal.
author: Lionel Trilling

quote: I especially love all the instruments of art: inks, pens, paintbrushes, watercolors and oils, fine papers and canvases, and although I love to mess around with these tools and objects, I have minimal artistic skills.
author: Sharon Creech

quote: I decided on the spot that I would be an artist, and I assure you, it was no ordinary artist I had in mind.
author: Henry Ossawa Tanner

quote: Dancers are a work of art - they are the canvas on which their work is painted.
author: Patrick Duffy

quote: Even a true artist does not always produce art.
author: Carroll O'Connor

quote: Every work of art is aggressive, Isabella. And every artist's life is a small war or a large one, beginning with oneself and one's limitations. To achieve anything you must first have ambition and then talent, knowledge, and finally the opportunity.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón,  The Angel's Game

quote: A great artist can paint a great picture on a small canvas.
author: Charles Dudley Warner

quote: Every human is an artist. The dream of your life is to make beautiful art.
author: Don Miguel Ruiz

quote: No great artist ever sees things as they really are. If he did, he would cease to be an artist.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Artists exist to show us the world. So do windows.
author: Jarod Kintz,  At even one penny, this book would be overpriced. In fact, free is too expensive, because you'd still waste time by reading it.

quote: For a true artist, difficulties become opportunities and clouds become solid present.
author: Alejandro Jodorowsky

quote: Every artist dips his brush in his own soul, and paints his own nature into his pictures.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: I am more a friend of art than a producer of painting.
author: Paul Cezanne

quote: All art constantly aspires towards the condition of music.
author: Walter Pater

quote: Real artists take the misery and sadness of life and translate it into art.
author: Josh Peck

quote: A painter, who finds no satisfaction in mere representation, however artistic, in his longing to express his inner life, cannot but envy the ease with which music, the most non-material of the arts today, achieves this end. He naturally seeks to apply the methods of music to his own art.
author: Wassily Kandinsky

quote: To be an artist means never to avert one's eyes.
author: Akira Kurosawa

quote: An artist is forced by others to paint out of his own free will.
author: Willem de Kooning

quote: Art is whatever you can get away with.
author: Marshall McLuhan,  The Medium is the Massage

quote: A great artist is always before his time or behind it.
author: George Edward Moore

quote: I am an artisan. I only became an artist when people watch what I do. That is when it becomes art.
author: Rhys Ifans

quote: An artist cannot fail; it is a success to be one.
author: Charles Horton Cooley

quote: Music has the power to bring people together like no other art form.
author: Michael Franti

quote: In art the best is good enough.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Art is a collaboration between God and the artist, and the less the artist does the better.
author: Andre Gide

quote: As a composer and as a musician I'm a true believer - and this is not to be overly diplomatic - I'm a believer that there's artistry in everything from a lawn gnome to a desk chair to a symphony to an Andy Warhol painting. There's art in absolutely everything.
author: Darren Criss
